title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Seat and Battery - Remove - DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

body.body: Rear Master Cylinder Removal DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC
The brake caliper will require removing and the pistons pushed out to back bleed the master cylinder as part of the brake bleeding procedure.
Remove the rear brake caliper mounting fixings and slide the caliper off the brake disc.
Make sure no damage is made to the brake pad material when moving the brake pads.
Allowing the brake pads to come into contact with each other or sharp objects may cause the material to crack or break.
Damage to the brake pads may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

Using a suitable a flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the rear brake pedal until the plate is held by the brake pads.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Detach rear brake fluid reservoir citi_1

body.body: Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Disconnect the rear brake light switch from the main harness.
Disconnect the brake line from the rear master cylinder. Discard the sealing washers.

body.name: Rear brake master cylinder hose cjgy

body.body: Remove the fixing securing the brake light switch and bracket assembly to the right hand control plate.
Slide the brake light switch rearwards and detach it from its locating pin on the right hand control plate.
Brake light switch and bracket assembly
Remove the clip and clevis pin at the lower end of the brake pushrod.

body.name: Brake master cylinder clevis pin cjgs

body.body: Remove the two fixings and remove the rear brake master cylinder from the right hand control plate.

body.name: Rear master cylinder mounting bolts cjgx

body.body: Release the clip, and noting its orientation, remove the brake fluid reservoir and hose from the master cylinder.

body.name: Rear brake master cylinder hose cjgt
